comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Abernathy_Boys_of_Oklahoma Louis Abernathy (1900-?) and Temple Abernathy (1904-1986) were children from Oklahoma who without adult supervision took several cross-country trips. On one trip they rode their motorcycle from Oklahoma to Manhattan in 1910 when they were 10 and 6 years old.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: New York Times story, June 1, 1910, reports the boys, then 9 and 6, rode horses all the way from Oklahoma to Washington, D. C., where President William Howard Taft greeted them at the White House: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9400E... New York Times story, June 4, 1910, reports boys' reception at Capitol building, where they were brought onto the floor of the House and greeted by Speaker Joseph Cannon: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9F07E4D81530E2... New York Times story, June 7, 1910, reports boys have left Washington, headed for Baltimore: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=990DE2DF1E39E3... New York Times story, June 9, 1910, reports boys and their horses in Baltimore as they journey from Washington, D. C. to New York City. Their mother died three years earlier, but their father, U. S. Marshall John ("Jack") Abernathy is interviewed -- one of Teddy Roosevelt's Rough Riders, and a famous Oklahoma wolf catcher, he has killed 400 wolves with his bare hands: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9F02EFDF1E39E3... New York Times story, June 10, 1910, places the boys in Wilmington, Delaware, still headed north: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9B01E6D71530E2... New York Times story, June 13, 1910, reports that the boys have joined their father in New York City, and occupied the Rockefeller pew at First Baptist Church: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9C01E3D71530E2...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Temple Abernathy's widow, Alta Abernathy, wrote "Bud and Me," a book about their adventures as told by Temple. Bud was Temple's name for his older brother, Louis Abernathy.
